cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba / about 300 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin moving NW soon)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, cross or skirt the northern Yucatán Peninsula late Monday, enter the central Gulf Tuesday, and approach the north-central Gulf Coast (SE Louisiana/Mississippi coastline) early Wednesday before accelerating northeast inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near the Buras–New Orleans area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning confined to Tulum–Rio Lagartos (Yucatán) and Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Río, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel (Yucatán Peninsula)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatán Peninsula, western Cuba, and the northern Gulf Coast from the TX-LA border eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible late Tuesday through Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (around 1 ft) possible in Sabine–Neches estuary if the storm makes a closer approach, but guidance currently keeps surge below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–2 in of rain with isolated 3 in totals Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding on low-lying roads and elevated river levels if heavy rain bands linger
